document_data.name: Vangol Kuskolt
document_data.mainbody: '''Vangol Kuskolt''' was a [[dwarven]] [[priest]] of [[Tyr]] active in the [[Sword Coast North]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite web/D&D Beyond/Divine Contention}}
document_data.Description: He walked heavily on an [[iron]] [[Prosthetic|peg leg]].
document_data.Activities:
Vangol assumed the duties of presiding over the [[Tyr Shrine (Leilon)|Tyr Shrine]] when it was repaired and rebuilt along with the town of [[Leilon]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. He soon became the newfounded community's judge, presiding over and adjudicating legal disputes on the steps of his shrine. When he judged a criminal guilty of an awful crime, he would heat his peg leg in a fire and use it to brand the guilty party before driving them out of town.

Shortly after his arrival, he became one of Leilon's five town councilors.
